helpText.value: Measure incoming and outgoing energy at top of atmosphere.

sunlightRadiation.value: Sunlight radiation: yellow waves, wavelength shorter than infrared

infraredRadiation.value: Infrared radiation: red waves, wavelength longer than sunlight

homeScreenDescription.value: Explore greenhouse effect with wave representation.

playAreaDescription.value: The Play Area is an observation window showing a scene extending from the surface of the Earth to outer space. It has controls to adjust the greenhouse gas concentration or explore by time period, add clouds, and measure the energy balance.

controlAreaDescription.value: The Control Area has options for displaying the surface temperature of Earth. You can control how fast the action happens in the observation window including buttons to pause and step forward.

homeScreenDescription.value: Explore greenhouse effect with photon representation.

exploreModeHelpText.value: Explore concentration manually or by time period.

helpText.value: Explore greenhouse concentrations during specific time periods.

concentrationSliderHelpText.value: Adjust amount of greenhouse gases in the atmosphere.

playAreaSummary.value: The Play Area is an observation window set up with a light source and a molecule. It has options for light source and molecule.

controlAreaSummary.value: The Control Area has options for how fast the action happens in the observation window including buttons to pause and step forward. You can also access details about the light spectrum and reset the sim.

simIsPausedOnSlowSpeed.value: sim is paused on slow speed

interactionHint.value: Turn light source on to explore.

buttonPressedHelpText.value: Turn light source off to stop photons.

buttonUnpressedHelpText.value: Turn light source on to start photons.

photonEmitterOffDescriptionPattern.value: {{lightSource}} light source is off and points directly at {{target}}.

breakApartPhaseDescriptionPattern.value: {{lightSource}} photon absorbed, {{photonTarget}} molecule breaks into {{firstMolecule}} and {{secondMolecule}}.

lightSourceRadioButtonHelpText.value: Choose light source for observation window ordered low to high energy.

spectrumButtonDescription.value: Examine details of full light spectrum.

spectrumWindowDescription.value: The Light Spectrum shows the relative energy of the different classifications of light waves as defined by their characteristic wavelengths (measured in meters) and frequencies (measured in Hertz or inverse seconds).

spectrumWindowEnergyDescription.value: The order from lowest energy (lowest frequency and largest wavelength) to highest energy (highest frequency and smallest wavelength) is Radio, Microwave, Infrared, Visible, Ultraviolet, X-ray, and Gamma ray.

spectrumWindowSinWaveDescription.value: A sine wave decreasing in wavelength (as measured by the distance from peak to peak) and increasing frequency (as measured by the number of waves per time interval) from Radio to Gamma Ray.

spectrumWindowLabelledSpectrumDescriptio.value: In detail, the frequency and wavelength ranges for each spectrum, listed from lowest to highest energy

spectrumWindowLabelledSpectrumRadioFrequ.value: Frequencies less than 10 to the 4 Hertz to 10 to the 9 Hertz.

spectrumWindowLabelledSpectrumRadioWavel.value: Wavelengths greater than 10 to the 4 meters to 5 times 10 to the negative 1 meters.

spectrumWindowLabelledSpectrumMicrowaveF.value: Frequencies 10 to the 9 to 5 times 10 to the 11 Hertz.

spectrumWindowLabelledSpectrumMicrowaveW.value: Wavelengths 10 to the negative 1 to 10 to the negative 3 meters.

spectrumWindowLabelledSpectrumInfraredFr.value: Frequencies 5 times 10 to the 11 to 4 times 10 to the 14 Hertz.

spectrumWindowLabelledSpectrumInfraredWa.value: Wavelengths 10 to the negative 3 to 7 times 10 to the negative 7 meters.

spectrumWindowLabelledSpectrumVisibleFre.value: Frequencies 4 times 10 to the 14 to 7 times 10 to the 14 Hertz.

spectrumWindowLabelledSpectrumVisibleWav.value: Wavelengths 7 times 10 to the negative 7 to 4 times 10 to the negative 7 meters.

spectrumWindowLabelledSpectrumVisibleGra.value: Shown as a rainbow starting with red and ending with violet (red, yellow, green, blue, indigo, violet).

spectrumWindowLabelledSpectrumUltraviole.value: Frequencies 10 to the 15 to 10 to the 16 Hertz.
Wavelengths 4 times 10 to the negative 7 to 10 to the negative 8 meters.

spectrumWindowLabelledSpectrumXRayFreque.value: Frequencies 10 to the 16 to 10 to the 19 Hertz.

spectrumWindowLabelledSpectrumXRayWavele.value: Wavelengths 10 to the negative 8 to 5 times 10 to the negative 11 meters.

spectrumWindowLabelledSpectrumGammaRayFr.value: Frequencies 10 to the 19 Hertz to greater than 10 to the 20 Hertz.

spectrumWindowLabelledSpectrumGammaRayWa.value: Wavelengths 5 times 10 to the negative 11 meters to less than 10 to the negative 12 meters.

linearGeometryDescription.value: Linear, a molecule with two or three atoms bonded to form a straight line. Bond angle is 180 degrees.

bentGeometryDescription.value: Bent, molecule with a central atom bonded to two other atoms that form an angle. Bond angle varies below 120 degrees.

tetrahedralGeometryDescription.value: Tetrahedral, molecule with a central atom bonded to four other atoms forming a tetrahedron with 109.5° angles between them, like four-sided dice.

longStretchingAlert.value: Bonds of molecule stretch back and forth.

longBendingAlert.value: Bonds of molecule bend up and down.

slowMotionBreakApartPattern.value: Photon absorbed. Molecule breaks apart. {{firstMolecule}} and {{secondMolecule}} float away.

moleculePiecesGone.value: Molecule pieces gone. Reset or change molecule.

photonsOnSlowSpeedSimPaused.value: Photons on slow speed. Sim paused.

simPausedEmitterOnAlert.value: Sim paused. Step forward for detailed exploration.

simPlayingHintAlert.value: Turn light source on to play sim.

stepHintAlert.value: Turn light source on to use Step Forward.
